values:
New name because this name was annoying me.



So yeah...

Hrm... the fact that my LJ name is spelled wrong (Don't think I never noticed, I've always known, I've just never fixed it) has been annoying me lately.  So I think I'll just make a new name.

But anyway.  Today was another boring day.  But I did find out something abnormal occurring in the mind of my parents.  If anyone has watched the news recently, Thailand had been hit by a tsunami, resulting in some 140,000 deaths.  Anyway, my mom was talking to me and she said, "Phillip, what would you say to us adopting someone."  And so I am thinking, haha, funny, jokes, yeah.  Then she says, "(Storm, blah blah, thailand, misfit children, blah) your dad may want to adopt a child who lost his/her parents."

...?

So yeah, a bit random, but I'm not 100% sure if they are serious, but it did sound like it.  The possibility would be somewhat interesting.  It would be quite an experience, for better or for worse.  Well, who knows what will happen?

Eh, so I think this will be the last entry before I make a new LJ name.  Peace.
Know what... LJ brings out the worst in me and today I refuse to let it do that. FUCK YOU LJ! Merry Christmas everyone!

(This entry is pretty much pointless and does not have some major controversial end to it, so only read if you are bored.)

I don't know if anyone had thought of this, but it came to my mind while I was at the mall.  

So everyone knows all about the Lance Armstrong bracelets and its for a good cause, blah blah blah.  Don't get me wrong, I won't wear one unless someone gives it to me, but it is a good cause.  But anyway, I noticed  that a person in front of me at Todd's was wearing a Livestrong bracelet.  So being that it is a common thing now, I just basically kept thinking about whatever I had been thinking of.  Then I hear "I'll have a small diet coke, please."  For some reason or another, I just thought... "Wait a second.  Doesn't Diet Coke use a artifical sugar that generates cancer?"  This may sound like I'm trying really hard to bring down people do this, but I'm just thinking.  Doesn't drinking diet coke and wearing a Liverstrong bracelet make them contradictory to each other?

I don't know where this came from, so don't hate me for it.  I think I was just looking for any excuse to find something to think about at the time other than all the antics of people in the mall.

There are so many things I life that I take for granted, but I'm starting to realize what these things are.  First and foremost, my brother.  It seems like any time I've been down he's always been there to help me back up.  He gives without asking and never complains to me when I do something wrong, but he tries to help me.  

I believe there are so many things that not many people do not take the time to appreciate anymore.  One of these things , which is so plainly obvious, is probably most helpful.  Music.  I can't think of any point in my life when music hasn't been there.  I remember since the 6th grade that music has always been my escape.  It doesn't matter what type of music you enjoy, but its just the fact that these melodies, all the simple and complex melodies, that could have been contrived in a matter of minutes, can be so influencial to the way you act and/or think.  So many times music has changed my moods just by the amazing sounds produced on instruments mass produced to fit the needs of every person wanting to fill their void.  Like Jake said, its the language of the soul, spoken through a microphone, guitar, bass, drums, or any other instrument.  It speaks to everyone in a different way, but everyone can find a common ground through it.

Its so hard to explain how I feel on things.  Not because I have bad literary skills, just because my way of thinking and speaking on certain things doesn't come out exactly how I see it.  

God... so random.

I STUDIED MORE THAN I HAVE EVER STUDIED BEFORE IN MY HISTORY OF HIGHSCHOOL! Fuck you CHEMISTRY!

I don't think I ask for much.  But for some reason, I don't seem to get much, in more than one sense.

Tonight consisted of the following:
  1. Trying to make plans to do something.
  2. Going to Trey's house, which ultimately ends up in me just standing around because they are practicing and I refused to take them to buy beer.  Seriously... I am no one's chauffer anymore.  Bitches...
  3. Going to Ian's house, not seeing him at all, saying a few words to Max, then leaving before I even see Ian.
  4. Aimlessly trying to find something to do.
  5. Go to Dibbz because I'm bored out of my mind.
  6. Got bored of video games and decided to drive around some more.
  7. Went to Starbucks, bought a Tall Vanilla Latte.
  8. Drove to the top of the parking lot, sat on the railing, drank my coffee.
  9. While sitting up there, I just thought, "Why can't I find what looking for?"  I'm a pretty genuine person, I don't get pissed at small things, I'm no genius, but I have more common sense then one, I guess I'm an alright looking guy from my standpoint (and still getting better).  It just boggles me how I just get left behind.
  10. Home...

And so it comes to the one thing that I have always feared happening to the durggies: Coke has invaded our school.

I'm going to leave it at that for certain safety reasons. If you are wondering if I am one of the victims, you don't know me too well. And if you don't know if that was a yes or no... it was a no.

I don't feel the need to summarize the past few weeks because, 1) I don't think anyone really reads these entries. 2) My life is still boring. But I've actually decided, aside from all my previous vows, to study more whole-heartedly than I usually do for exams. I spent two hours at Starbucks today just studying for one subject. I really need to prove to myself that I can go above and beyond what I think I can do. I need to do the best I can.  So, go me.

I really don't have anything interesting to say, other than my personal feelings on a few things.  The only thing that has given me a bit of pride has been the fact that I, along with two or three of my friends, have been standing up for the 8th graders that play hackey sack.  A group of 9th or 10th graders have been making fun of them a lot, so we decided, as "big" upperclassmen, to help the underdog.  It was amusing, really. One of our friends starting bitching them out very unpleasantly and Dallas decided to start making fun of them after they were verbally owned by our other friend.  He was just saying stupid things like, "Wow, you just got schooled, in school" and "You can say anything you want about me, I already know I'm ugly." I just found the whole back to 6th grade jokes hilarious, since we usually say shit like that when we're joking around.  So we did our good deeds and it feels pretty good.

But anyway... still where I was last time but with my feet on the ground.  Peace.

Party Tomorrow!

Keg x 2 = Good

Call for info.








I'll make an effort to write a real update soon.

I haven't felt like updating at all lately, and I don't feel like writing right now.  I'll just give some updates in bullet form.

  • Want to quit at Schubert's soon.  Dibbz would be an awesome place to work, but no positions as of yet.
  • Show last night: Awful Waffle - Good despite the tech errors and the fact that I couldn't hear them sing.  Cinema City- What the fuck? At first I though Not bad, then I was hit by the sound of some whining little piss ant complaining in a unintelligable language of emo-core poo. 1.) Your drummer sucks 2.) Stop whining 3.) Bassist is really good, but doesn't go with the music 4.) STOP WHINING! 5.) The only crowd in there was all the little pseudo-hardcore emo girls that no nothing about real talent and ogle over the band members because they are playing "nice" music.  (All the hardcore, talented, and good tasted people were outside.)  Didn't watch anyone else, but I did pull a drive by with my new Airsoft pistol on the AW drummer!
  • I'm thinking about starting my own custom snare line.  Everyone seems to like the one I built for myself.
  • Got a new Deftones shirt and what? I've sold everyone out... I'm sorry.  A pair of A&F jeans. I didn't buy them though, my Aunt and Uncle did, I just wear them.
  • Still no girlfriend, but meeting new people.
  • Dibbz owns! If you have any interest in computer or console games, or even if you like internet cafes, go.
  • Spending a lot of time lately working out.  Its a good way to get out energy and I actually have fun.
  • School is getting better, even though I had a big argument with my religion teacher who sent me out of class twice in two days... what a bigity bitch. Haha, thanks Dave Chappelle.
  • We've actually started filming! What? Its crazy, we've actually gotten things done.
  • Finally got reached 2 g's.  Going for 3.
  • I got a date for homecoming.  Only problems are that I don't know who she is, where she lives, what she looks like, etc.  But guess what? I don't care, haha.
  • I NEED TO SEE SHAUN OF THE DEAD!!! FRIDAY! WHO'S COMING???!?!?!?

So sums up the life of Philthy Phil. PEACE

Wtf? I guess LJ decided to update.  Whatever.

It doesn't matter because MY LEGS FUCKING HURT!

God damn... both of my legs are in pain, but the good pain.  The kind you get a day after working out more than you usually do because you are pissed.  Its good though, because now I have a new way to relieve stress and get in shape at the same time.  Woo.

On a much more serious note, school has started to annoy me already.
Algebra II, American History, Religion III, I hate you.  
English IV and Fine Arts Survey, I love you.
Chemistry... Eh, whatever.

So concludes my thorough description of school.

Party, Saturday, Joe's House.  Go.  Call me if you want to

But I adore her
This will never happen
But I adore her
This will never happen
Over my dead body
Of course I think about it
Burn my path if it does
Shape my body as I feel
Torn
Shape my body as I feel
Torn and broken
And if it happens
I'll burn and crawl deeper in my hole
Darkness always says hello
And your burning body will light my way
Burning body light my way

Go Ivan! You ruined my birthday.

To celebrate, this morning at 12:00, grabbed a Heniken out the freezer and toasted to myself.  No more curfew at least.

Basically a boring summer-like day.  Everything is all nice outside and there is shit to do.  Almost every business is closed and everyone is still out of town.

Probably try and go see a movie if its open after dinner.  Hoorah..

So Ivan seems to be headed in our direction.  But unlike everyone else, I think I'm going to stay with my dad.  I'm not necessarily afraid because I doubt that it will hit us at all.  Even if it does hit us, it don't think it will still be a Cat. 5. 

Later today, since I don't have school, I'm going to go to Schuberts to help my dad brace all of the boats for the pounding we're supposed to receive. 

If anyone is evacuating tomorrow, I'd like to get lunch with someone because its probably going to be very lonely if everyone is out of the state. 

For everyone who is leaving or staying, be safe.  Peace.

Just a quick question.

Would anyone object to me wrestling?

I really think it would help me get into better shape.  But I'm worried about two things.

1. The time it takes up
2. No offense, but the showers.  I've heard some vulgar things...

I have rediscovered my love for two things today.  1. Rap  and 2. Metal

I downloaded a whole bunch of songs today.  Probably about 150. :D

These bands include....

  • Wu-Tang Clan
  • Nelly
  • Eminem

and

  • Megadeth
  • Avenged Sevenfold
  • Slayer
  • Acid Bath
  • Children of Bodom
  • From Autumn to Ashes

Woot.  Finally got to the chance to drink last night.  Didn't get drunk, but just the fact that I got to drink at all was awesome.  Heniken all the way! 

My birthday is Thursday, and we all know what that means!  PORN PORN PORN! Lmao, just kidding.  All presents welcome... it doesn't have to be tangible though :)

I'm going to see if I can have a small party with some alcohol this weekend, I'll talk to my parents about it, I think it might work out, but don't hope for anything.  Anyway, if anyone wants to go out with us this weekend, HOLLA!

Post your name in my comments I'll tell you exactly what I think of you.  No sugarcoating, no lies, just the god honest truth. Then post this and do the same.

I'll try... ask for pleasant or straightup.

Someone finally got it.  This man, single-handedly dissed all of the people who have not realized just how bad their taste in music is.  Not only did he completely own all of those fans, he made it funny.

If you don't know what I'm talking about, go the the link and watch the Adema video, its the best one.
http://www.youhavebadtasteinmusic.com/


Thank you YHBTM man.

Last night Scarlett, Trey and I went and saw Collateral.  It was a great movie, but I need to see it again, because we had a slight problem.  WE WERE IN THE VERY FRONT ROW!  Damn, I hate when that happens.

Also, the mall has become a seizure of colors and people.  It was rediculous to see all these kids just "hanging out".  Seriously... this has got to stop.  As one of my friends from HC that I saw pointed out, during a conversation while waiting for his girlfriend by the bathroom.

"Now that just ruins my faith in this mall."
"What are you talking about?"
"A girl just walked by wearing bondage pants, all gothed out, with a Story of the Year T-Shirt."
"Hrm..."

Whats worse, is there a kids, a little more than half my age, walking around like gangstas.  For instance, there was a little kid walking around with his brother (I'm assuming), and both were decked out with a headband, Basketball jersey (-undershirt), and those really, redicously long shorts that look like two paperbags sewn together.  But the climbmax of their appearance was the fact that both of them, were grabbing their balls THE WHOLE TIME.  I mean... really, the kid with him was about 9-10.  We wonder why everyone is so screwed up?

But aside from the crazy antics of teens in the mall, I'm pissed at a certain someone at BM.  I'll just lay it out for you.

I have been planning on forming a club called Musicians United, to help out people who play an instrument and don't want to be in jazz band.  Everyone thinks its a great idea, EVEN the principle, who told me that it was "A very innovative" idea twice.  So I go to talk to the activites director and she tries her best just to shoot me down the whole time.  It basically went back and forth like this

LeBlanc: You see, forming this club would conflict with the Jazz Band, because thats what they are offering.
Me: Actually... Jazz Band does not really does not offer the chance to learn how to read music.  So most of the students who want to join, can't.  So this is the alternative.
Leblanc:  Well... blah

But whatever, I'll just keep annoying them.So far, this has undoubtedly been my best start in school.  I've gotten nothing less than an A on my tests and I only missed one assignment (but in Religion so it doesn't count).

Anyone want to go see Collateral with me?  Possibly in a good seat?

Also, I'm accepting applications for a girlfriend, because I'm just not getting anywhere by doing other things.  

I'm such a loser, haha.

Oh shit I remember.   I think my brother wants to take the Mustang to Orange Beach, even though he already has a car?  I hope he doesn't, because first off its not running at the moment and two I WANT IT!

Today, after school, I found out during the Drama club meeting that Total Art auditions are Sept 08.  I'm not worried about being able to play something, but Trey won't be there that day.  I can probably just talk to Mr. Joyner about letting us just get in without an audition, or just play another day.

I can't even think about what I wanted to write before, I'm tired.

Night

People in New Orleans suck at driving.

Haha.  I got my first ticket for parking in the opposite flow of traffic.  This just goes to show you why B.M. needs a bigger parking lot.  Even Tom got a ticket for the exact same thing.

Whats going down this weekend?  Besides homework.

I don't know if anyone has heard these guys before, but they are good.  They deserve a listen.
http://www.purevolume.com/riseagainst

School is cool.  So I think I'll stay. 

Sunday Trey and I went and got buff at Metairie Country Club.  After we finished working out we went in the steam room for about half-hour or forty-five minutes... holy shit.  To some of you this may sound unrealistic, but its happened before.  Within that time frame in the steam room, (I had weighed myself before), I had lost 4 pounds.  I know its basically all water weight, and I probably already gained it back in water, but it still made me feel awesome.  I want a steam room now.

Woke up this morning and felt fine up until after first period.  When I stood up my legs felt (and still feel) like they were on fire and my boobs were really hurting.  I realize that it means I got a good workout, but ow.

I think I'm going to start going to work out Tuesday and Thursday so I can get skinny and be buff (but not muscle head buff, just regular buff?).  If anyone wants to go, holla.  I can only bring one guy and a girl because I can sign them in as my brother and sister  I'd have to pay ten dollars for each person if they were signed in as guests.

Trey and I have been thinking that we need to join more clubs to put on our transcripts so we're joining: Newspaper, Welcoming Diversity(?), and I'm creating a club called Musicians United!

Ownage.

Damn.  The Japs owned us in Men's Gymnastics.  Those guys are amazing on high bar.  

Oh well.  First day of school was pretty good.  Nothing amazing but I won't complain... yet.  My teachers seemed to be pretty nice, except for one or two, but besides them its probably going to be hard as hell.  Well, have a nice night.
New haircut + Hat + A few hours = Ownage!

10 questions: Pick a band and answer only using that band's song titles.

Band: Alice in Chains

1. Are you male of female: Man in the Box

2. Describe yourself: I Know Somethin'

3. How do some people feel about you?: Got Me Wrong

4. How do you feel about yourself?: Love Hate Love

5. Describe your love interest: Real Thing

6. Where would you rather be?: I Can't Remember

7. Describe what you want to be: Rain When I Die

8. Describe how you live: Down in a Hole

9. Describe your love: Sea of Sorrow

10. Share a few words of wisdom: Don't Follow

Today was a mediocre day.  Finally bought my warranty for the camera and that was about it.  The whole morning and part of the after was spent working, trying to think of a plot for a movie, reading, and being an internet bum. 

Just got back from the Village.  It was really good for those of you who haven't seen it.  Very good plot.

But I realized something right after dropping Trey off. I drove to the stop sign and remembered something Trey had said a few weeks ago.  I sat for a minute and just thought.  I think I realized that I need to just let go of certain things and just stop trying to get somewhere I'm not going to be.  I've been procrastinating with these ideas and I really believe that nothing, has come out of them.  This whole time... and I've been misleading myself.  I'm such an idiot for not seeing things the way they have been the whole damn time.

I'm sure to some people this will be plainly obvious, and to others, oblivious.  Goodnight.
Haha, holy shit.  Someone punch me in the stomach without warning the next time you see me.

FUCKING FISH!

I HATE YOU!

I'd like to punch every fish in Lake Ponchartrain (or however you spell it) IN THE FUCKING FACE!

STUPID FUCKING FISH!

You now have permission to die.

Stupid fuckers ruined my whole day, DIE!

And while I'm at it, FUCK MY BAD LUCK TOO!  I HATE YOU!

Today was a lot of fun.  Aside from the depressing (but amusing) scenes at the Alzheimer place for service hours.

After six or so hours of service, Trey and I picked up Ian and went to Schubert's.  We got the boat running and took it out for a ride in the lake for about a half hour since we only had a quarter tank of gas.  Then we picked up Joey and went back to my house, where Trey and I worked on our non-metal song? Crazy.  Its actually really good.  After awhile of jamming and taking pictures my brother called to see if we wanted to go sailing.  So Trey, Joey, and I (Ian went home because Tanya is a bitch) went to Pier One and met up with Jordan and Jill and went sailing.  We basically just talked about random things and everyone drinking, except moi (The DD).

Trey was seeing pink elephants.  

He came back to my house after we dropped Joey off.  He started talking about us being friends and his compulsions.  

Now I'm here, still not knowing how to post pictures.  Help would be appreciated.
I would post pictures that I took with my new camera... but I don't know how.  Help, anyone?

I'm a little bit confused.

It seems that everytime I try and even talk to someone, they... I don't know... ignore me.  Maybe I'm doing something wrong?  I guess everytime I talk I'm saying, "I'M A FUCKING LUNATIC, IGNORE ME!" when I'm trying to just have a conversation.  

Oh well, thats my luck.  Being nice gets me ignored.

I NEED TO GET THE MUSTANG RUNNING!

I also need a Digital Camera.... I think I might buy one tomorrow.  Any brand suggestions?

Is it just me, or do people take for granted the fact that they actually have jobs, and abuse their leniency?

Today I go to work like any other day, expecting to leave when I'm supposed to.

  • 1:00 pm -  No one shows up to replace me.  I can wait
  • 1:25 pm -  No one shows up to replace me.  I'll wait a little while, maybe their in traffic.
  • 1:40 pm -  No one shows up to replace me.  I call the replacements house to see where he is.

His mom answers the phone and I tell her why I'm calling and I'm told, "Stephen went to Memphis, and he won't be back until Thursday or Friday."  I ask why no one told us and she said that his father called for him.  Nope.  I love how people can't even take the time to call the place THEY work and just inform them of the situation.  No... I'll just leave and hope someone takes my shift.  Take some initiative people! Earn your pay.

...I'm going to fire his ass. :)

I'm actually not in a bad mood, despite that whole commotion.  Got a hair cut, didn't get my Drum Dial, but I found out which store never to go to again, and I feel like chilling tonight.

Yesterday was actually fun.  Scarlett, Trey, and I went driving around for a little while, talking of random things, but good conversations, and then we found All Star Lanes.  Funny shit there.  Bowled for awhile then dropped everyone off.

During the night Scarlett and I realized that no one ever plays Hide and Go Seek anymore.  We need to have a large gathering and play one night.  It would be kickin.

Sorry for being so morose lately.  I just stressed out and wasn't doing anything during the evening.

If anyone wants to do something, holla.

You Are
Tangerine

You are a beautiful person, in a wistful kind of way. If you could, you would spend all your time daydreaming and writing poetry. You are a tragic beauty.

You are sensitive and caring, and you don't take insults well. You don't smile much, but when you do, you really mean it.

People like to be around you because you are a calming influence. You have an appreciation for all things beautiful, and you probably have some potted plants. You also most likely own a cat.

You like Sundays and hot tea. You will spend your entire life yearning for quiet beauty, which is a rarity in this world, so you read a lot.

Everyone you know thinks you're "nice."

Hrm... "nice."

Tired... feel like shit... I don't care...

Every night I walk the streets, awake while everyone else sleeps.
I'm giving unease to anyone I meet.
My generosity can never run out, because I give a gift from what's within myself.
No hope at all. Take nothing from nothing and you'll have nothing left.
I can't recall. I can't recall a moment in my life when life was at it's best.
Everyone avoids my stare and no one cares to ever dare to look into the eyes of what they most fear.
And they're taught to fear, to fear no evil.
And they know no fear, they've learned to love themselves.

Though I have been going out every night for the past week, I really think I've accomplished nothing every time.  Trey, Chris, and I have been driving around for no reason, hoping we'll find something to do.  Suddenly I realize once again why this city sucks... it's based up alcohol.

It hits me, this city is not meant for people under twenty-one.  Even my twenty year old brother thinks this place sucks.  You are limited to so little when you are even one year away from twenty.  

Then once I realized what happens when you turn twenty-one, I get even more pissed.  What is there to do besides drinking in this state? Unless you are filthy rich like most of the fucking bastard ass customers at work, you have nothing to do.  Maybe I'm over reacting, but I really hate Louisiana.

Also, most of the people I know have been content enough to not even ask me to do anything.  But thats what friends are for, right?

Well, I'll just keep going out of my way to try and find SOMETHING to do in this shitty town.  Maybe a fight would be nice?  Oh well... I'll just shut up because I'm just being obnoxious and angry for no reason.  

Peace...

Woke up.  Went back to sleep.  Woke up and got something to drink.  Toaster caught on fire.(thanks sister...)  Browsed the web for stuff I'm going to need to build my snare drum.  Played a game or two.  Talked to my brother.  Saw Anchorman.  And the most random conversation with Trey.

(From the beginning, out of nowhere)

aerKISS: anyway the way i see it, they won't reach their goal unless they stick to the original plan
Elude the Sun: Well of course, because those god damn Indians aren't very good with plans
aerKISS: that's exactly what i mean, inbreeding results in people who talk like gobbling turkeys
Elude the Sun: They don't know the meaning of non-inbreds though.  They think that screwing their sisters and brothers is traditionally the way to go.
Elude the Sun: And you can't argue with tradition anymore.
aerKISS: which proves my point, international terrorism is plotted by those who are deeply disturbed because they never had their foreskin removed
Elude the Sun: Do they have a reason not to be disturbed?  If you look at the picture close enough, you can see that its not the fact that they didn't have the foreskin removed, because thats not the real story.  They just never had foreskin to begin with, so they are pissed because they can't be pissed that they didn't have it removed.
aerKISS: and that's the catch
Elude the Sun: The catch 22
Elude the Sun: We'd be fucked if they did have foreskins and if they didn't

(The End?)

Work...

Came home and took a shower.  Whitney came over for awhile and we watched I Love the 90's: 91.  Some funny stuff, but I also introduced her to Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law.  I'm guessing that she liked it because she told me it was her new favorite show. :)  Very random, but awesome.

After she left my brother and I watched The Butterfly Effect.  I'm shocked! Aschton Kutcher? Good? Holy shit! I have to admit that it was one of the better movies (serious movies) that I've seen.  The plot was amazing and all of the spins on each travel was really good. 

I can't really talk about it much because I'm tired as fuck, but rent it, buy it, pirate it, whatever, see it!  Also see Anchorman and Napoleon Dynamite!  Fucking hilarious!  NOW GO!

Well... two friends down, three left.  Unfortunately after the escapades of my friends in Mississippi, all of our parents have been informed that one of our friends is a druggy and an alcoholic.  Well thats at least what Tanya thinks, fuck her.  I don't like the fact that she doesn't bother to listen to us, or even bother to ask us about it before she makes assumptions.

So while Ian and Max are immobilized by the parental restraints, Trey, Joey and I are on our own.  Trey and I realized how big of losers we are once we realized it was only three of us.  Heh.   It happens. 

It could be good for us though, we'll be able to start hanging out with new people.  Enough of this, its in the past.

Went and saw Spiderman 2 for the second time last night.  Don't see it twice.  It definitely wasn't as good the second time.  I had to force myself to keep awake in the middle of the movie.  But the real moment of the night was when I was walking out of the arcade to see who Joey and Trey were talking to.  They were talking to some girl and when I walked up it went like this:

"Geez, how old are you?  You look like you are forty"

"Uh..... not really"

"Yes you are, you look like you could be their dad"

"Uh..... no, I'm not that old"

"Your lying"

"Want to see my License, I'm not forty"

"Yes" (Looks at license)"Oh..."

"We got to go to the movies, bye kids"

And that was the night.  Now I'm cleaning my room for mon mere.  Peace

Decided not to finish updating the other day... whatever.

Although I was excited to get back home, I've found that I hate this place.  The place I've grown up.  I really need to move out as soon as possible.  This place seems to only bring up all the bad things that I've wanted to forget.  I'd really like to just get up, walk outside, steal my dad's truck, and just drive...  Not run away so to speak, but just leave and start over.

Everyone seems to be happy now.  All the dedication I've put into certain things have collapsed and I can't forget it.  Smoking, and thinking that it will make everything better, but just ending up making it worse by remembering everything and how I won't be able to do anything about it. 

All the shit I've dealt with, all the bent up anger that I've stored inside, all the tears that I've blinked back, everything I've done to try and make myself a better person seems not to get me anywhere.  Obviously I wasn't meant to get the things in life that you can't buy.

And despite everything... I can't forget.  I would give up anything just to forget the things that I have wanted.  But of course I can't.  So I'll just have to keep going, knowing that I'm just going to be constantly hurt.

Lets see.  Went on the college run and I have to say that I was very surprised to find that it was very fun.  I was somewhat scared that it was going to suck, but I was wrong.

The first day was pretty fun.  On most of the days I don't remember which college we visited or if we did at all.  Auburn I think.  I really liked that school.  Most everyone didn't like it for some reason or another.  But I still really liked campus and such.  Probably #3 on my top 3.

Second day we were late... my bad.  Rando was pretty mad, but I took the blame so he hated me.  It was all good though.  Went to Georgia Tech and that was a very nice school.  It had all the trinkets you could want.  The campus was very nice and it was a nice thing that the college was basically connected to the city by way of a small bridge.  #2.

From here until the 7th day was pretty boring with colleges, but mixed in with random funny things, and just being stupid.  It was our free day, and we had a shitload of fun.  Went to Aero Space museum first and looked at all the planes and such.  Met up with Annie, lost Annie when we ate, then found her and she left for the Arts Museum (later met up again at Natural History).  Went to Natural History, where we repeatedly tried to get rid of people who were following us.  The mammal section was all I saw, but I heard the other sections were just "okay".  Then we went and sat for a little while on the mall where I completely annihilated Ian in a tackle, played some hackey sack, and made a fire.  Then we found some guy with big signs on the street, talking about his group trying to get people to stop circumcising their children.  He was telling us about how much better it was with the... while... you know.  Anyway he was going to take a picture of us by the sign when he said, "SAY PENIS!" and I completely started cracking up because I was on the phone with my dad.  Took pictures of Ian, Joey, Max, Joe, and Tom walking around with signs that said random things from a er... can't think of the word (where you walk around outside the memorial or whatever with signs, chanting various crap).  Went home.

Then we went to University of Virigina.  Woooohoo.  It was great.  The campus was beautiful, the academics sounded great, and the social sounded cool.  Our tour guide was really cool and was telling us about a streaking tradition they had.  Ian offered to do it then and there.  I'm also going to be on TV... along with the rest of our group, because they were filming us for this Politics reality show.  Nothing amazing, but it'd be cool to see myself on TV.  But after that it was still getting better with all the things they have around campus, secret societies, and just general campus life.  Thats definitely my favorite.  #1!!!!!!!!!

I'm tired... I'll finish updating later.

First off.  What is with the whole sausage thing? I really can't seem to understand that for the life of me.

Anyway.  Today was full of stressful shopping.  Most because my mom likes to get the best of everything when any of us go away.  Its all in good intent, but I really don't need to spend a lot of money on things I don't need.  I'm a simple person, I don't need much besides a computer, food, and friends.  A girlfriend would be nice too (I probably seem like a whiny bitch saying this every entry, haha). 

All of the sudden, people from HC are calling wanting to hang out with me.  Unfortunately none of them call at good times.  Bah.  I want to hang out with them but I'm always occupied, my bad.  I shall make time after the college run.

After the shopping excursion, I went to Borders (the place I needed to go to use the gift card) to go find a book.  Little did I know how much that place sucks.  I really didn't like the way everything is organized there, but as long as I find what I'm looking for, I'm good.  Looked around for awhile and came across a book I had been wanting to read.  So I bought it.  Catch 22, not only an amazing band, but also said to be a great book.  I know what a lot of people are thinking after I said that, "He just bought it because of the band", and I didn't (for the most part).  A friend of mine had actually read it and said it was very good, so I decided to get it.  Just because I like the band doesn't mean I only bought it for that reason, even though the book has NOTHING to do with the band.  And I've found myself rambling to a lifeless monitor.  Need to stop.

So I'll just keep going.  Apparently, we're going to be on a bus for 7 hours... yay.  Plenty of time to eat my 3 BAGS OF BEEF JERKY & drink my GALLON GREEN TEA! Woot.  And also a good chance for me to catch up on my reading and listening to music.

I found a new band, if anyone is interested.  Belvedere.  From Canada, punk, but in my opinion they are really good.  Its not all the same chord the whole time. If you are a pirate, download Repetition Rejection.

I think my new cheesy ass "poser" shirt fits me very well.  "Bored, Lazy, Hungry... seeking band or girlfriend".  It should be & girlfriend. 

When I get back, I'm going on a crusade.  Fuck the holy land, I'm finding a girlfriend.
